attributes.value: / Raster is an image processing lib for Rust.
/ It provides a simplified API for processing raster images (JPEG, PNG and GIF).
/ Add this to your Cargo.toml file:
/ Where x are version numbers of the [latest version](https://crates.io/crates/raster) of raster. Eg.: 0.1.0
/ Then add the raster crate in your main.rs:
/ extern crate raster; // In your main rust file
/ Raster will detect the image format based on the file name.
/ use raster::Image; // Include the Image struct
/ // Create a blank 150x100 image. Defaults to a black background.
/ Here are two images blended using the normal mode.
/ More blending modes and options are available, see the blend API.
/ An example of images resized to "fit" in a 200x200 box.
/ More modes available, see the resize API.
/ Images can be rotated both clockwise and counter-clockwise at any arbitrary angle with a custom background color.
/ More options are available, checkout the modules below.

defs.name: similar
defs.docs:
Compare two images and returns a hamming distance. A value of 0 indicates a likely similar picture.
 A value between 1 and 10 is potentially a variation. A value greater than 10 is likely a different image.

attributes.value: / Compare two images and returns a hamming distance. A value of 0 indicates a likely similar picture.
/ A value between 1 and 10 is potentially a variation. A value greater than 10 is likely a different image.

defs.name: equal
defs.docs:
Compare if two images are equal. It will compare if the two images are of the same width and height.
 If the dimensions differ, it will return false. If the dimensions are equal, it will loop through each pixels.
 If one of the pixel don't match, it will return false. The pixels are compared using their RGB (Red, Green, Blue) values.

attributes.value: / Compare if two images are equal. It will compare if the two images are of the same width and height.
/ If the dimensions differ, it will return false. If the dimensions are equal, it will loop through each pixels.
/ If one of the pixel don't match, it will return false. The pixels are compared using their RGB (Red, Green, Blue) values.

defs.name: editor
defs.docs: A module for common image editing operations.

attributes.value: /  A module for common image editing operations.

defs.name: blend
defs.value:
pub fn blend(&Image, &Image, BlendMode, f32, PositionMode, i32, i32)
-> RasterResult<Image>
defs.docs: Blend 2 images into one. The image1 is the base and image2 is the top.

attributes.value: / Blend 2 images into one. The image1 is the base and image2 is the top.
/ The `offset_x` and `offset_y` are added to the final position. Can also be negative offsets.
/ If image2 falls outside the canvas area, then this fails with `RasterError::BlendingImageFallsOutsideCanvas`.
/ // Blend image2 on top of image1 using normal mode, opacity of 1.0 (100%), with image2 at the center, with 0 x and 0 y offsets. whew

defs.name: crop
defs.value: pub fn crop(&mut Image, i32, i32, PositionMode, i32, i32) -> RasterResult<()>
defs.docs: Crop the image to the given dimension and position.

attributes.value: / Crop the image to the given dimension and position.

/ The `offset_x` and `offset_y` are added to the final position. Can also be negative offsets. Offsets can be used to nudge the final position. Or you can set the position to `PositionMode::TopLeft` and use the offsets as a normal screen x and y coordinates.
/ The cropped images arranged in a grid, showing how you can easily set the crop position.

defs.name: ResizeMode
defs.value: pub enum ResizeMode { Exact, ExactWidth, ExactHeight, Fit, Fill, }
defs.docs: An enum for the various modes that can be used for resizing.

attributes.value: / An enum for the various modes that can be used for resizing.

defs.name: resize
defs.value: pub fn resize(&mut Image, i32, i32, ResizeMode) -> RasterResult<()>
defs.docs: Resize an image to a given width, height and mode.

attributes.value: / Resize an image to a given width, height and mode.
/ use raster::{editor, Color, Image, ResizeMode, BlendMode, PositionMode};
/ // Superimpose images on a gray background
/ The gray box shows the 200x200 imaginary box that the images "fit" in.
/ The image fills up the entire 200x200 box.
/ The images will have a width of 200. The height is auto-calculated.
/ The images will have a height of 200. The width is auto-calculated.
/ The images will be resized to the exact dimension ignoring aspect ratio.

defs.docs: Getting or setting pixels outside of image bounds.

defs.name: Unexpected
defs.docs: Error that does not belong in other variants.

attributes.value: / Error that does not belong in other variants.

defs.name: RasterError
defs.value:
pub enum RasterError {
    Io(IoError),
    PixelOutOfBounds(i32, i32),
    InvalidStartIndex(i32),
    InvalidHex,
    HexParse(ParseIntError),
    BlendingImageFallsOutsideCanvas,
    InvalidGamma(f32),
    Decode(ImageFormat, String),
    Encode(ImageFormat, String),
    UnsupportedFormat(String),
    Unexpected,
}

defs.value: pub fn gamma(&mut Image, f32) -> RasterResult<()>

attributes.value: / Gamma can be a value from 0.01 - 9.99.
/ A gamma < 1.0 will darken and a gamma > 1.0 will lighten the image.

defs.name: saturation
defs.value: pub fn saturation(&mut Image, f32) -> RasterResult<()>

attributes.value: / Pass a float value for sat. < 0.0 to decrease and > 0.0 to increase. Eg 0.5 for 50% increase in saturation.
/ Note: Saturation does not look good at the moment.

defs.name: rotate
defs.value: pub fn rotate(&mut Image, i32, Color) -> RasterResult<()>
defs.docs: Rotate an image clockwise. Negate the degrees to do a counter-clockwise rotation. Background color can be any color.

attributes.value: / Rotate an image clockwise. Negate the degrees to do a counter-clockwise rotation. Background color can be any color.

/ Note: If you look closely, the quality for arbitrary angles is not very good due to the simple sampling algorithm. The 90, 180, and 270 angles looks fine because no pixels are lost. This will be fixed in the future with a better sampling algorithm.
/ ### Rotate 45 degrees with a black background color:
/ ### Rotate 45 degrees counter-clockwise with a red background color:

Resize image to exact dimensions ignoring aspect ratio.
 Useful if you want to force exact width and height.

Resize an image to fit within the given width and height.
 The re-sized image will not exceed the given dimension.
 Preserves the aspect ratio.

defs.name: hex
defs.docs: Create a color from hexadecimal value.

attributes.value: / Create a color from hexadecimal value.
/ If the hex *string* is malformed (doesn't begin with `#` or is of invalid length) then this
/ fails with `RasterError::InvalidHex`. If it passes that, but the string can't be parsed
/ into actual values, then this fails with `RasterError::HexParse`.
/ let color = Color::hex("#00FF007F"); // Green with 50% opacity
/ To get the value, use unwrap:

attributes.value: / Set pixel in a given x and y location of an image.
/ If either the x or y coordinate falls out of bounds, this will fail with
/ If the calculated byte start index is less than 0, this will fail with
/ let mut image = Image::blank(2, 2); // Creates a 2x2 black image.
/ let _ = image.set_pixel(0, 0, Color::rgba(255, 0, 0, 255)); // Set first pixel to red

defs.name: ImageFormat
defs.value: pub enum ImageFormat { Gif, Jpeg, Png, }

defs.name: PositionMode
defs.value:
pub enum PositionMode {
    TopLeft,
    TopCenter,
    TopRight,
    CenterLeft,
    Center,
    CenterRight,
    BottomLeft,
    BottomCenter,
    BottomRight,
}

defs.name: open
defs.docs: Create an image from an image file.

attributes.value: / Create an image from an image file.
/ This function can return `RasterError::Io`, `RasterError::Decode`, or `RasterError::UnsupportedFormat` upon failure.
/ See error module for more info.

defs.name: save
defs.docs: Save an image to an image file. The image type is detected from the file extension of the file name.

attributes.value: / Save an image to an image file. The image type is detected from the file extension of the file name.
/ This function can return `RasterError::Io`, `RasterError::Encode`, or `RasterError::UnsupportedFormat` upon failure.
/ See error module for more info.
